etymologies: late 19th century: named after Leopold von Sacher-Masoch (1835–95), the Austrian novelist who described it, + -ism

definitions: the tendency to derive pleasure, especially sexual gratification, from one's own pain or humiliation

examples.text: with things such as bondage and masochism, it's all right if you both go for it

shortDefinitions: tendency to derive sexual gratification from pain

definitions: (in general use) the enjoyment of what appears to be painful or tiresome

examples.text: isn't there some masochism involved in taking on this kind of project?

shortDefinitions: enjoyment of activity that appears to be painful or tedious
